conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible side/top faces, and interior space readable from an elevated angle.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and floor plane separation; good angled/isometric view; roof removed cleanly. Minor simplifications in corner detailing and opening geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall footprint and core circulation broadly resemble the plan (large central living area and right-side garage block are present), but several room boundaries/adjacencies appear simplified or shifted (notably left-side nook/study/patio regions and the exact bedroom/bath cluster geometry). Door and window placement does not consistently match the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Basic living room and kitchen cabinetry/island elements are present; some bed placeholders appear, but bathroom fixtures are largely absent/simplified and furniture is not comprehensive across all rooms.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean cutaway presentation with consistent materials and readable walls/floors. Lighting is adequate and geometry is mostly unambiguous; openings are somewhat generic.

detected_errors.description: Layout fidelity issues: multiple spaces on the left side (nook/study/covered patio zones) and some interior partitions/adjacencies appear simplified or not matching the 2D plan proportions.
Doors/windows are represented generically; many door locations/swing details and window placements do not clearly align with the 2D plan.
Furniture/fixtures are incomplete—bathrooms especially lack clear fixture layouts compared to the plan.

summary: A valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong 3D fundamentals, but only moderate geometric fidelity to the 2D plan due to simplified/shifted room partitions and generic openings/fixtures.
